_header: As thou were martyr and maid clean
_description: John Audelay, An orison to St Winifred — thirty quatrains (aaab) with burden (bb): ‘Wenefrede thou swete may / Thow pray for vs bothe nyght & day’

BodDou302.First Lines:
Als þou ware marter & mayd cleneþer for þou
                    hadist terment & tene…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…ffore I hit mad with wepyng yeMi name hit is þe blynd
                    awdlay
BodDou302.Editions:
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 171-5.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 216-8; 1977, 191-3.
